name: Visibility Controls for Editor Blocks
author: Denis Doroshchuk

sections.description:
Visibility Controls for Editor Blocks is a plugin for WordPress that allows you to control the visibility of Gutenberg blocks on mobile, tablet, and desktop devices. You can easily hide or display blocks based on user-configurable breakpoints.

License

This plugin is licensed under the GPLv2 or later. You can find more information at https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.html.
sections.installation:
1. Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/visibility-controls-for-editor-blocks directory, or install the plugin through the WordPress plugins screen directly.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress.
  3. Go to “Settings > Gutenberg Blocks Visibility” to configure the breakpoints for mobile, tablet, and desktop devices.
sections.faq:
How do I configure the breakpoints for mobile, tablet, and desktop?

After activating the plugin, go to the WordPress admin panel, and under Settings > Gutenberg Blocks Visibility, you will find options to configure the breakpoints for mobile, tablet, and desktop devices.
sections.changelog:
1.0.0

  • Initial release with functionality to hide blocks on mobile, tablet, and desktop devices.
  • User-configurable breakpoints for each device type.
